speaker: PANDARUS
text: Friend, you, pray you, a word. Do you not

speaker: PANDARUS
text: follow the young Lord Paris?

speaker: MAN
text: Ay, sir, when he goes before me.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: You depend upon him, I mean.

speaker: MAN
text: Sir, I do depend upon the Lord.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: You depend upon a notable gentleman. I

speaker: PANDARUS
text: must needs praise him.

speaker: MAN
text: The Lord be praised!

speaker: PANDARUS
text: You know me, do you not?

speaker: MAN
text: Faith, sir, superficially.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Friend, know me better. I am the Lord

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Pandarus.

speaker: MAN
text: I hope I shall know your Honor better.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: I do desire it.

speaker: MAN
text: You are in the state of grace?

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Grace? Not so, friend. “Honor” and “Lordship”

speaker: PANDARUS
text: are my titles. What music is this?

speaker: MAN
text: I do but partly know, sir. It is music in parts.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Know you the musicians?

speaker: MAN
text: Wholly, sir.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Who play they to?

speaker: MAN
text: To the hearers, sir.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: At whose pleasure, friend?

speaker: MAN
text: At mine, sir, and theirs that love music.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Command, I mean, friend.

speaker: MAN
text: Who shall I command, sir?

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Friend, we understand not one another. I

speaker: PANDARUS
text: am too courtly and thou art too cunning. At whose

speaker: PANDARUS
text: request do these men play?

speaker: MAN
text: That’s to ’t indeed, sir. Marry, sir, at the request of

speaker: MAN
text: Paris my lord, who is there in person; with him the

speaker: MAN
text: mortal Venus, the heart blood of beauty, love’s visible

speaker: MAN
text: soul.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Who, my cousin Cressida?

speaker: MAN
text: No, sir, Helen. Could not you find out that by her

speaker: MAN
text: attributes?

speaker: PANDARUS
text: It should seem, fellow, that thou hast not

speaker: PANDARUS
text: seen the Lady Cressid. I come to speak with Paris

speaker: PANDARUS
text: from the Prince Troilus. I will make a complimental

speaker: PANDARUS
text: assault upon him, for my business seethes.

speaker: MAN
text: Sodden business! There’s a stewed phrase indeed.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Fair be to you, my lord, and to all this fair

speaker: PANDARUS
text: company! Fair desires in all fair measure fairly

speaker: PANDARUS
text: guide them!—Especially to you, fair queen, fair

speaker: PANDARUS
text: thoughts be your fair pillow!

speaker: HELEN
text: Dear lord, you are full of fair words.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: You speak your fair pleasure, sweet

speaker: PANDARUS
text: queen.—Fair prince, here is good broken music.

speaker: PARIS
text: You have broke it, cousin, and, by my life, you

speaker: PARIS
text: shall make it whole again; you shall piece it out

speaker: PARIS
text: with a piece of your performance.

speaker: HELEN
text: He is full of harmony.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Truly, lady, no.

speaker: HELEN
text: O, sir—

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Rude, in sooth; in good sooth, very rude.

speaker: PARIS
text: Well said, my lord; well, you say so in fits.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: I have business to my lord, dear queen.—

speaker: PANDARUS
text: My lord, will you vouchsafe me a word?

speaker: HELEN
text: Nay, this shall not hedge us out. We’ll hear you

speaker: HELEN
text: sing, certainly.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Well, sweet queen, you are pleasant with

speaker: PANDARUS
text: me.—But, marry, thus, my lord: my dear lord and

speaker: PANDARUS
text: most esteemed friend, your brother Troilus—

speaker: HELEN
text: My Lord Pandarus, honey-sweet lord—

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Go to, sweet queen, go to—commends himself

speaker: PANDARUS
text: most affectionately to you—

speaker: HELEN
text: You shall not bob us out of our melody. If you

speaker: HELEN
text: do, our melancholy upon your head!

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Sweet queen, sweet queen, that’s a sweet

speaker: PANDARUS
text: queen, i’ faith—

speaker: HELEN
text: And to make a sweet lady sad is a sour offence.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Nay, that shall not serve your turn, that

speaker: PANDARUS
text: shall it not, in truth, la. Nay, I care not for such

speaker: PANDARUS
text: words, no, no.—And, my lord, he desires you that

speaker: PANDARUS
text: if the King call for him at supper, you will make his

speaker: PANDARUS
text: excuse.

speaker: HELEN
text: My Lord Pandarus—

speaker: PANDARUS
text: What says my sweet queen, my very, very

speaker: PANDARUS
text: sweet queen?

speaker: PARIS
text: What exploit’s in hand? Where sups he tonight?

speaker: HELEN
text: Nay, but, my lord—

speaker: PANDARUS
text: What says my sweet queen? My cousin will

speaker: PANDARUS
text: fall out with you.

speaker: HELEN
text: You must not know where he sups.

speaker: PARIS
text: I’ll lay my life, with my disposer Cressida.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: No, no, no such matter; you are wide.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Come, your disposer is sick.

speaker: PARIS
text: Well, I’ll make ’s excuse.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Ay, good my lord. Why should you say Cressida?

speaker: PANDARUS
text: No, your poor disposer’s sick.

speaker: PARIS
text: I spy.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: You spy? What do you spy?—Come, give me

speaker: PANDARUS
text: an instrument.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Now, sweet queen.

speaker: HELEN
text: Why, this is kindly done.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: My niece is horribly in love with a thing you

speaker: PANDARUS
text: have, sweet queen.

speaker: HELEN
text: She shall have it, my lord, if it be not my Lord

speaker: HELEN
text: Paris.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: He? No, she’ll none of him. They two are

speaker: PANDARUS
text: twain.

speaker: HELEN
text: Falling in after falling out may make them

speaker: HELEN
text: three.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Come, come, I’ll hear no more of this. I’ll

speaker: PANDARUS
text: sing you a song now.

speaker: HELEN
text: Ay, ay, prithee. Now, by my troth, sweet lord,

speaker: HELEN
text: thou hast a fine forehead.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Ay, you may, you may.

speaker: HELEN
text: Let thy song be love. “This love will undo us all.”

speaker: HELEN
text: O Cupid, Cupid, Cupid!

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Love? Ay, that it shall, i’ faith.

speaker: PARIS
text: Ay, good now, “Love, love, nothing but love.”

speaker: PANDARUS
text: In good troth, it begins so.

speaker: HELEN
text: In love, i’ faith, to the very tip of the nose.

speaker: PARIS
text: He eats nothing but doves, love, and that breeds

speaker: PARIS
text: hot blood, and hot blood begets hot thoughts, and

speaker: PARIS
text: hot thoughts beget hot deeds, and hot deeds is love.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Is this the generation of love? Hot blood,

speaker: PANDARUS
text: hot thoughts, and hot deeds? Why, they are vipers.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Is love a generation of vipers? Sweet lord, who’s

speaker: PANDARUS
text: afield today?

speaker: PARIS
text: Hector, Deiphobus, Helenus, Antenor, and all the

speaker: PARIS
text: gallantry of Troy. I would fain have armed today,

speaker: PARIS
text: but my Nell would not have it so. How chance my

speaker: PARIS
text: brother Troilus went not?

speaker: HELEN
text: He hangs the lip at something.—You know all,

speaker: HELEN
text: Lord Pandarus.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Not I, honey sweet queen. I long to hear how

speaker: PANDARUS
text: they sped today.—You’ll remember your brother’s

speaker: PANDARUS
text: excuse?

speaker: PARIS
text: To a hair.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Farewell, sweet queen.

speaker: HELEN
text: Commend me to your niece.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: I will, sweet queen.

speaker: PARIS
text:
They’re
               
              come
               
              from
               
              the
               
              field
              .
               
              Let
               
              us
               
              to
               
              Priam’s
               
              hall

speaker: PARIS

To
               
              greet
               
              the
               
              warriors
              .
               
              Sweet
               
              Helen
              ,
               
              I
               
              must
               
              woo
               
              you

speaker: PARIS
text:
To
               
              help
               
              unarm
               
              our
               
              Hector
              .
               
              His
               
              stubborn
               
              buckles
              ,

speaker: PARIS
text:
With
               
              these
               
              your
               
              white
               
              enchanting
               
              fingers
               
              touched
              ,

speaker: PARIS
text:
Shall
               
              more
               
              obey
               
              than
               
              to
               
              the
               
              edge
               
              of
               
              steel

speaker: PARIS
text:
Or
               
              force
               
              of
               
              Greekish
               
              sinews
              .
               
              You
               
              shall
               
              do
               
              more

speaker: PARIS
text:
Than
               
              all
               
              the
               
              island
               
              kings
              :
               
              disarm
               
              great
               
              Hector
              .

speaker: HELEN
text:
’Twill
               
              make
               
              us
               
              proud
               
              to
               
              be
               
              his
               
              servant
              ,
               
              Paris
              .

speaker: HELEN
text:
Yea
              ,
               
              what
               
              he
               
              shall
               
              receive
               
              of
               
              us
               
              in
               
              duty

speaker: HELEN
text:
Gives
               
              us
               
              more
               
              palm
               
              in
               
              beauty
               
              than
               
              we
               
              have
              ,

speaker: HELEN
text:
Yea
              ,
               
              overshines
               
              ourself
              .

speaker: PARIS
text:
Sweet
              ,
               
              above
               
              thought
               
              I
               
              love
               
              thee
              .
